what: Mapping Exposures and Cumulative Risk of Hazardous Air Pollutants in the United States
title: Mapping Exposures and Cumulative Risk of Hazardous Air Pollutants in the United States
text: Pipeline Spatio-Temporal mapping Hazardous Air Pollutants using Gaussian Process project maps concentrations hazardous air pollutants (HAPs) fine resolution across United States recent years (2018-2021). utilize multivariate, penalized, land-use-regression model spatiotemporally correlated errors simultaneously model several HAPs interest, using HAPs data EPA’s Ambient Monitoring Archive covariate data several atmospheric, meteorological, land cover, emissions variables, among others. use Multivariate Matern Gaussian Process modeling coupled General Vecchia approximation, enabling simultaneous variable selection LUR estimation fixed random effects large number variables. Additionally, employ state---art analysis pipelines ensuring model results reproducible tested.
